definition: to unite/unity/solidarity/united
dumpling
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
unity is strength (revolutionary slogan and popular song of 1943)
pinyin: tuan2 jie2 jiu4 shi4 li4 liang5

definition: Solidarity (Polish worker's union)
national unity

sentences.english: In 1999, ethnic unity and progress has been exemplary Linying advanced individuals.
sentences.chinese: 1999年，获临颍县民族团结进步模范先进个人。

sentences.english: As long as we unite and help each other, no one can conquer us.
sentences.chinese: 只要我们团结互助，谁也不能征服我们。

sentences.english: Union with Christ means that when Christ died, I died with Him.
sentences.chinese: 与基督团结意味着当基督死去的时候，我与他同死。

sentences.english: We have achieved genuine stability and unity.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经实现了安定团结。

sentences.english: The great friendship and militant solidarity between the peoples of our two countries are unbreakable.
sentences.chinese: 我们两国人民的伟大友谊与战斗团结是坚不可摧的。
神话尚未结束，韩国团结一心。

sentences.english: But the price for such solidarity will be very high.
sentences.chinese: 但毫无疑问这种团结的代价将无比高昂。

sentences.english: This congress reflects the unprecedented unity of writers and artists throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 这次大会，标志着全国文艺工作者的空前团结。
他们的团结被称为“汉萨”。

sentences.english: We deeply appreciate Russia's expression of solidarity with India at this moment.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常感谢俄罗斯此时此刻对印度表达的团结精神。

sentences.english: He wanted to form an all-party government of national unity.
sentences.chinese: 他想成立一个维护国家团结的多党执政政府。

sentences.english: The energy in your job sector is all about unity and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 职责方面的能量都是关于团结互助的。

sentences.english: The losers and maimed quell their sniffling for the sake of unity.
sentences.chinese: 失败者们会为了党内的团结而停止他们的抱怨。

sentences.english: The Weill family were very close-knit, as were many immigrant Jewish families of that era.
sentences.chinese: 一如当年许多犹太移民家族，魏尔家也是非常团结的。

sentences.english: Their sense of solidarity is deepened by the loneliness of being in a foreign country.
sentences.chinese: 他们的团结意识由于深处异国他乡而更加深化了。

definition: cohesion/cohesiveness/cohesive
to be of one mind/to work as one
to twist together to form a rope/(fig.) to unite/to work together
unity of will is an impregnable stronghold (idiom)
of one mind (idiom)
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
friendly affection/fraternal love
to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
group mentality/collectivism/solidarity/team spirit
peaceful relations/harmonious
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
to live in harmony/to get along with each other
millions of people all of one mind (idiom); the people united
to endorse/to support
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
